bioghist.p: Historian, educator, and writer, Katherine C. (Kasey) Grier was born in 1953, in Utica, NY. She is a graduate of the Cooperstown Graduate Program in Historical Museum Studies (M.A. 1980. While at CGP, she became interested in the work of John Scholl, 1827-1916, a farmer and carpenter from Germania, PA who began carving wooden sculpture at the age of 80.
bioghist.head: Biography/History

scopecontent.p: Research material collected by Katherine C. Grier (1953- ) and drafts, for a catalog essay, Celebrations in Wood: The Sculpture of John Scholl 1827-1916, which accompanied an exhibition at the William Penn Memorial Museum, Harrisburg, PA, November 1979-March 1980; and her Cooperstown Graduate Program, Cooperstown, NY, thesis, Celebrations in Wood: The Carvings of John Scholl (1827-1916), 1980.
scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Research materials include: biographical material and published articles about Scholl; cassette tapes of interviews with Scholl’s relatives; correspondence between Grier and dealers and owners of Scholl’s works; documentation from exhibitions including Scholl’s first, John Scholl Celebrations, at the Marian Willard Gallery, NY, NY November 28-December 30, 1967; images (photos, photocopies, and negatives) of Scholl; his family, homestead, and predominantly, his sculptures; Grier’s notes for assorted papers and a lecture; and sheet music for folksong about Germania, Potter County, PA, Scholl’s hometown. The Scholl sculpture files, organized by owner, then title of work, document the provenance of ca. 35 of his works and often contain images.
